description: This header file defines a C++ wrapper around D-Bus calls and signals, including types, classes, and usage constructs for interacting with D-Bus via GLib in a C++ environment. It provides structures for defining and executing remote method calls, handling signals, and working with D-Bus data types and variants, intended as part of a client library for D-Bus communication.

classes.name: GDBusCall
classes.description: Base class representing a D-Bus method call, facilitating creation of call definitions, parameter binding, and execution via callSync().

methods.name: callSync
methods.description: Executes the D-Bus call synchronously, handling serialization of input parameters and deserialization of output parameters.

classes.name: GDBusSignal
classes.description: Base class for managing D-Bus signals, including registering callbacks for signal reception.

methods.name: registerCallback
methods.description: Registers a callback function to be invoked when a specified D-Bus signal is received.

classes.name: GDBusVariant
classes.description: A wrapper class for handling D-Bus variants, providing methods to retrieve values as various types and to print the contained value.

methods.name: getString
methods.description: Retrieves the variant content as a string.

methods.name: print
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the variant's contents.

classes.name: GDBusTuple
classes.description: Helper class to represent and assign values from unmarshalled D-Bus tuples, with nested field classes for common types.

methods.name: assign
methods.description: Assigns values from a vector of GDBusVariants to the tuple's fields.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the tuple's contents.

ctags.pattern: /^#define GDBUS_CLIENT_GDBUSCLIENT_HPP$/

ctags.pattern: /^    struct GDBusCall {$/

ctags.name: TYPE_ANY
ctags.pattern: /^        struct TYPE_ANY     { const char *gType = "*";   };         \/\/ A synthetic type, to de/

ctags.name: TYPE_AO
ctags.pattern: /^        struct TYPE_AO      { const char *gType = "ao";     };      \/\/ D-Bus composite type 'a/

ctags.name: TYPE_AS
ctags.pattern: /^        struct TYPE_AS      { const char *gType = "as";     };      \/\/ D-Bus composite type 'a/

ctags.name: TYPE_ATUP
ctags.pattern: /^        struct TYPE_ATUP    { const char *gType = "a(*)";   };      \/\/ A synthetic type, an ar/

ctags.name: TYPE_B
ctags.pattern: /^        struct TYPE_B       { const char *gType = "b";      };      \/\/ D-Bus type 'b', a boole/

ctags.name: TYPE_D

ctags.name: TYPE_DICT
ctags.pattern: /^        struct TYPE_DICT    { const char *gType = "a{ss}";  };      \/\/ D-Bus composite type 'a/

ctags.name: TYPE_I

ctags.name: TYPE_T

ctags.name: TYPE_U

ctags.name: TYPE_V

ctags.name: TYPE_Y
